e4: Switching to the new policy supports corporate integrity and transparency, reflecting true earnings without manipulation. Although there may be initial confusion among investors, clearer communication and education can mitigate these effects. Long-term, this approach reduces legal risks and bolsters investor trust, potentially enhancing firm reputation and stability. Maintaining ethical standards should be prioritized over short-term market reactions.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize accuracy, honesty, and transparency, providing all investors with a true reflection of the company's financial health. It should comply with legal standards and ensure that no group of investors is advantaged or disadvantaged based on their knowledge or resource level. Furthermore, ethical reporting entails clear communication about any policy changes to mitigate confusion and maintain trust among stakeholders.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management plans to communicate the change in reporting policy to ensure all investors understand and do not mistakenly adjust the reported EPS. Additionally, I would inquire about measures to monitor investor reactions and whether any educational initiatives are planned to help them correctly interpret the new, unbiased financial reports.
